page.title: 16Matthew and Clares Houses
page.content: I am Clare who lives in 'Kemps', the oldest house in Portslade.When we moved in we practically lived in one room, now the kitchen,whilst Dad worked on the front room,pulling the ceiling down to expose oak beams.The main beam has a notch along it,which means it was pre-plague.The timber was probably from shipwrecks.He cleared out the fireplace to find a lovely inglenook.He put in a bathroom in a little room under the stairs as we only had an outside toilet and a sink. Dad has started on the bedrooms.A staircase goes up and round into a huge attic where my parents will have their room. I am Matthew who lives in a modern, four bedroomed,centrally heated house. It has a dining room and sitting room with a modern fire.Ours was the last house built and the garden was a dump.
